skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.

security_audit.summary: The skill consists of documentation and example snippets only. No executable scripts, file operations, environment access, or network behavior are present in the skill files.

content.user_title: Apply aeon methods to time series problems
content.value_statement: Choosing time series models is complex and costly. This skill summarizes aeon options and provides task focused examples for common workflows.
actual_capabilities: Explain aeon classifiers and selection tradeoffs
Summarize forecasting and anomaly detection methods
Describe segmentation and similarity search options
Guide feature extraction and preprocessing choices
limitations: Requires the aeon Python package to run any code
Does not execute training, evaluation, or plotting
Does not access or load user datasets

prompt_templates.title: Starter classifier
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a fast aeon classifier for a small labeled dataset. Explain accuracy and speed tradeoffs and the first parameters to tune.

prompt_templates.title: Forecasting plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline an aeon forecasting approach for short horizons. List the assumptions and the key hyperparameters to start with.

prompt_templates.title: Anomaly strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest aeon anomaly detectors for point and subsequence anomalies. Explain when to choose each detector.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a pipeline using aeon transformers for feature extraction and a scikit learn classifier. Explain the data shape requirements.

output_examples.input: Help me pick a fast time series classifier for a small dataset
output: Use MiniRocketClassifier as a fast and accurate baseline
Validate with a simple train and test split

best_practices: Normalize series before distance based models
Start with ROCKET variants as strong baselines
Validate with a held out split and simple metrics
anti_patterns: Using deep models on very small datasets
Skipping normalization for distance based methods
Ignoring the required input shape for aeon

faq.question: Is this compatible with Python and scikit learn?
faq.answer: Yes. Aeon provides scikit learn compatible APIs and runs in Python environments.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and examples only. It does not run code or evaluate models.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with sklearn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Aeon transformers and estimators are designed to work in sklearn pipelines.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or data?
faq.answer: No. It does not read files, environment variables, or external services.

faq.question: What should I do if results are poor?
faq.answer: Check normalization, start with a simple baseline, and tune key parameters such as window size or kernels.

faq.question: How does aeon compare to generic ML tools?
faq.answer: Aeon provides time series specific models and distances that generic tools do not include.
